climbs.name: Solar Oven
climbs.fa: Don Wilson, Todd Gordon, and Pat Brennan

content.description: This is a steep face route on the southeast side of Isles In The Sky.  It receives morning sun.  The start is a committing crank on a questionable flake, leading to better protected climbing above.  This route is not in the 1992 Vogel guide.

climbs.name: Pinky and the Brain
climbs.fa: (TR) George Zelenz 1990, FL: Todd Gordon, Grant Hiskes & Suzette Olsen

content.description:
It is located on the southeast side of the Isle In The Sky formation (around and left of the main northeast face) on a block on the lower right side (to the right of and down from Hidden Corridor).  You'll see a tall, well-featured face which is the route.

The climbing is up large plates and edges, and while the rock is mostly solid it hasn't seen much traffic and is still cleaning up some.
content.protection: 10 bolts, bolted anchor/rap. Some long slings are helpful. 60m rope needed.

climbs.name: Metabolic Frolic
climbs.fa: Don Wilson, Dave Haber, Sheryl Haber, Rick Briggs, and Alan Bartlett

content.description: This steep face route on the southeast side of Isles In The Sky gets morning sun.  It is not in the 1992 Vogel guide.
Climbs the prominent overhanging face/arete that overlooks Park Blvd.
content.location:
Located between

Don's Crack

and

Pinky and the Brain

on a south-facing pillar.

content.description: This is a steep finger and hand crack, starting to the right of Solar Oven, etc. on the southeast side of Isles In The Sky.  It is just to the right of a dihedral, and near the right side of the entrance to a corridor.  The 5.10A rating assumes that you stem off the wall behind the crack.  This climb is not in the 1992 Vogel guide.
